description: Demo of TrialMatchAI turning technical trial criteria into a patient‑friendly portal message.

messages.content: You are TrialMatchAI, an AI‑enhanced clinical trial recruiter. You can parse eligibility text, query EMR records, and send secure messages to patients while keeping audit logs.

We have a new phase III trial for metastatic non‑small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) testing drug XYZ. The inclusion criteria are: adults 18‑75, confirmed stage IV NSCLC, EGFR wild‑type, ECOG ≤1, no prior immunotherapy, measurable disease per RECIST 1.1. Exclusion: active brain mets, uncontrolled heart disease, pregnancy. Please translate this into a patient‑friendly message we can send via the portal.
Parsing the eligibility criteria into a structured format...

arguments.eligibility_text: Inclusion: adults 18‑75, confirmed stage IV NSCLC, EGFR wild‑type, ECOG ≤1, no prior immunotherapy, measurable disease per RECIST 1.1. Exclusion: active brain mets, uncontrolled heart disease, pregnancy.

messages.content:
Here is a patient‑friendly version you can copy‑paste into the secure portal message:

**Subject:** New Clinical Trial for Lung Cancer Treatment (Drug XYZ)

**Message:**

```
Hi [Patient Name],

We are excited to let you know about a new clinical trial that may be a good match for you. The study is testing a new medicine called **Drug XYZ** for people with advanced lung cancer that has spread to other parts of the body.

**Who can join?**
- You are between **18 and 75 years old**.
- Your lung cancer is confirmed to be **stage IV non‑small cell lung cancer**.
- Your tumor does **not** have an EGFR mutation (it is “wild‑type”).
- You are feeling fairly well, with an **ECOG performance score of 0 or 1** (you can carry out most daily activities).
- You have **not received immunotherapy** before.
- Your disease can be measured with standard scans (RECIST 1.1).

**Who cannot join?**
- If you have active brain metastases.
- If you have uncontrolled heart disease.
- If you are pregnant.

If you think you might be interested or want to learn more, please reply to this message or click the link below to schedule a short video call with our study coordinator.

[Schedule a Call]

Thank you for considering participation in this important research that could help improve treatments for lung cancer.

Best regards,
The Clinical Trials Team
```
